page.title: 05Ecology of Longdon (Fauna)
page.content:
{Birds: }usual plus black-headed gulls, 3 species of owl, wheatears, both wood peckers, tree-creepers, nuthatches, warblers and nightingales. A spotted fly-catcher successfully reared a brood in an abandoned black-bird's nest in the school-house car-port.
{Animals:}foxes and rabbits abound; there are badger setts on the ridge. The local schoolmaster reared 3 orph- aned badger cubs. He took them the spare school milk and dinners. He often had to retrieve the empty bowls from a blackthorn clump! They rejected steam-baked white bread for wholemeal.
From a choice of soft grass, barley straw and wheat straw, the badgers selected the first two for use as bedding in their setts.
